executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Greg and James pitched their product, Chocolas, a revolutionary grip enhancement solution, on Shark Tank seeking $400,000 for 4% equity. After a live demonstration showing a 60% improvement in grip performance, Kevin O’Leary and guest shark Rashan offered a joint deal under royalty terms, which the entrepreneurs accepted.
keyDecisions: Greg and James accepted a joint investment offer from Kevin O’Leary and Rashan for $400,000 in exchange for a $2.50 royalty per unit until $4 million in revenue is reached, then $0.25 per unit in perpetuity plus 4% equity.

actionItems.task: Send sample packages of Chocolas to 100 athletes for product exposure and endorsements
Leverage Kevin’s social media team to increase awareness and reduce customer acquisition cost (CAC)
Use Rashan’s athlete network to distribute Chocolas among professional sports players

nextSteps: The team will begin implementing the partnership strategy by distributing product samples to athletes and leveraging the sharks’ social and professional networks to drive brand visibility and sales.
